greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Average digit (rounded up) in the decimal expansion of a prime number.
example: The prime numbers begin with 2,3,5,7,11,13,17,19,23,... so the average digits rounded up are 2, 3, 5, 7, (1+1)/2=1, (1+3)/2=2, (1+7)/2=4, (1+9)/2=5, ceiling((2+3)/2)=3, ...
results.author: Y. Kelly Itakura (yitkr(AT)mta.ca), Aug 23 2002
ext: Offset changed to 1, cf. to A073342 added, and extended by _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 23 2008
